bioghist.p: Robert J. Baptista was Vice President of Manufacturing in the Fibers, Additives and Rubber Division of the Bayer Corporation until his retirement in 2000. He began his career at the company as a research chemist at the Verona Dyestuff Division in 1972, and between 1977 and 1985 was Plant Manager for two of the company's Bayonne facilities.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of scrapbooks and company manuals Baptista compiled on various plants and companies in the dye industry. Many of these companies eventually merged with Bayer Corporation. Included are histories of Verona Dyestuffs, Harmon Colors, Pharma Chemical, Mobay Chemical Corporation, General Analine and Film Corporation (GAF), Beaver Chemical Works, as well as Bayer Corporation itself. The scrapbooks contain histories compiled by Baptista and others, aerial photographs, photos of employees, management and facilities, company documents, such as articles of incorporation and patents, newspaper clippings, and plant location maps. These scrapbooks are the basis for many of the articles on the website colorantshistory.org, a site founded and maintained by Baptista and dedicated to history of the synthetic organic chemical dye industry. Also included in this collection are miscellaneous printed materials, books of paint and yarn samples, Bayer annual reports, copies of Bayer Research magazine, and materials relating to the decommissioning of the Haledon, NJ plant (owned by Miles, a predecessor of Mobay), and company's plan for environmental remediation at the site.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
